title: Is IB harder than university? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s a bigger jump and probably a lot more content than a typical course. Comparatively less advanced, but more content and probably a bigger jump in difficult for the average entrant. University students start at the level they were after IB or at least are expected to and thus less of jump. Big jumps in difficulty really test IQ and personality probably less so than competence.
No. IB prepared me for university in terms of study habits. But the content is not the same level of difficulty. It would be weird if it was.

The IB curriculum is very rigorous and requires hard work. It is great preparation for college level courses. College courses still move through content faster and expect deeper learning, but IB will prepare you well for making that shift.
